description.para: Calls the AWS Panorama ListDevices API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para:
Returns a list of devices.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.
Filter based on a device's status.
Filter based on device's name. Prefixes supported.
The target column to be sorted on. Default column sort is CREATED_TIME.
The sorting order for the returned list. SortOrder is DESCENDING by default based on CREATED_TIME. Otherwise, SortOrder is ASCENDING.
The maximum number of devices to return in one page of results.

Specify the pagination token from a previous request to retrieve the next page of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Devices'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Panorama.Model.ListDevicesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Panorama.Model.ListDevicesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
Filter based on a device's status.
The maximum number of devices to return in one page of results.
Filter based on device's name. Prefixes supported.

Specify the pagination token from a previous request to retrieve the next page of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Devices'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Panorama.Model.ListDevicesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Panorama.Model.ListDevicesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
The target column to be sorted on. Default column sort is CREATED_TIME.
The sorting order for the returned list. SortOrder is DESCENDING by default based on CREATED_TIME. Otherwise, SortOrder is ASCENDING.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.Panorama.Model.Device objects. The service call response (type Amazon.Panorama.Model.ListDevicesResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

description.para:
Returns a list of nodes.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

The maximum number of nodes to return in one page of results.

Specify the pagination token from a previous request to retrieve the next page of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Panorama.Model.ListNodesResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ApplicationInstanceId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ApplicationInstanceId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'PackageObjects'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Panorama.Model.ListApplicationInstanceDependenciesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Panorama.Model.ListApplicationInstanceDependenciesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.Panorama.Model.PackageObject objects. The service call response (type Amazon.Panorama.Model.ListApplicationInstanceDependenciesResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
